author: @notme4526
text: Capital B in MB is megabyte , an lowercase b in Mb is megabit just a quick easy way to remember if you forget. ISP's tend to like to advertise connection speeds in megabits because the numbers sound much bigger lol 500 megabits sounds better than 50 megabytes but it's give or take the same.

author: @johnhunt1813
text: Maybe the transfer rate you are used to is 100 mega bits / sec, and this is just 12 mega BYTES per second. I believe a megabit is 1/8 the size of a megabyte, so 12*8 ~= 100 mega bits / sec. Again, could be wrong, but I think the standard is Mb is megabit, and MB is megabyte.

author: @joshhaas7240
text: You shouldn't do "shutdown" or similar from within the VM; Linode has a reboot watchdog (enabled by default; you can turn it off) that will detect that as an unexpected shutdown and automatically reboot the node. If you have the watchdog enabled, you should always do shutdowns from the Manager or API for consistent behavior.  If anyone's curious, that's why (A) the node came back up from the stackscript and (B) why he was able to immediately reconnect to the GPU server after the detach/attach without issuing a boot command from the Manager.  https://www.linode.com/docs/uptime/monitoring-and-maintaining-your-server/#configure-shutdown-watchdog https://www.linode.com/community/questions/17657/why-did-lassie-reboot-my-linode

author: @MachineLearningwithPhil
text: I tried paperspace and wasn't particularly happy with it. I had to submit a written request to get a quadro class GPU, which delayed the whole process. And then the GPU had significant run to run variations in terms of performance. It didn't really save me any time, and felt just like a waste of money. Kind of like renting a car as your daily driver. I came to the conclusion that just building a rig with 2x Turing cards was the better option for the long term.

author: @aswathgi6468
text: Very much required for a novice, who's planning for DL projects!   My personal notes for everyone:  - I love AWS, you can also get free subscription from amazon if you attend any hackathons hosted by them! :) - Google is cool, everything is easy, but I heard its little bit costlier than aws! check it out.  - paperspace is the best, most of the DL frameworks and other libraries are preinstalled! Recomened to use this if you are planning for a big DL project!  "Little bit pricely, but totally worth it!"  - Azure, is best when comes to Big Data, but I haven't used for DL project, so no comments :| - Linode, gotta try.   Also if you are a student and want a free cloud GPU to try, here is the something you can do:  - Go to intel cloud, and search for free cloud gpu for student projects.  - you will be asked to mail them about, why you wanna use it. Just explain the project.  - Within a week you will get a link, which allows to use their cloud for a month & also you can mail them and extend the time period.  Pretty Good, I have used tensorflow in it and it works fine!
